meanings.sent1: The martinet at the school made sure all the students followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The new manager was known as a martinet, always enforcing the company policies.
meanings.sent3: The martinet chef in the kitchen ensured that every dish was prepared perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The martinet conductor directed the orchestra with precision and authority.
meanings.sent5: The martinet drill sergeant trained the recruits with unwavering discipline.

meanings.definition: A person who demands strict adherence to rules and regulations.
meanings.sent1: As a martinet, he expected everyone to follow the guidelines without question.
meanings.sent2: The martinet supervisor checked that all employees complied with the safety protocols.
meanings.sent3: The martinet librarian insisted on complete silence in the reading room.
meanings.sent4: The martinet judge held everyone in the courtroom to the highest standards.
meanings.sent5: The martinet coach pushed the team to excel through rigorous training.

meanings.definition: Someone who enforces strict discipline or control.
meanings.sent1: The martinet in charge of the military base ensured order was maintained at all times.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a martinet for her unwavering commitment to upholding the rules.
meanings.sent3: The martinet referee made sure the game was played fairly and by the book.
meanings.sent4: The martinet principal kept the school running smoothly with firm leadership.
meanings.sent5: The martinet coach pushed the athletes to their limits to achieve success.
